name: Pharaoh
description: King of Egypt who enslaved Israel and defied God through ten plagues. His hardened heart became his doom as he pursued Israel to the Red Sea.

throne-defiance.name: Throne Defiance
throne-defiance.description: Seated on throne, dismissing Moses with arrogant wave
throne-defiance.prompt: Egyptian Pharaoh seated on golden throne in full royal regalia - double crown of Egypt, golden crook and flail crossed over chest, one hand raised in dismissive wave, face showing utter contempt, 'Who is the LORD that I should obey him?'

hardened-heart.name: Hardened Heart
hardened-heart.description: Fist to chest, refusing to yield despite plagues
hardened-heart.prompt: Egyptian Pharaoh standing with fist pressed to chest - jaw set in stubborn defiance, eyes blazing with unyielding will, plague effects visible around him but unmoved, heart of stone refusing to break, doubling down on destruction

commanding-slaves.name: Commanding Slaves
commanding-slaves.description: Cruel overseer demanding more bricks without straw
commanding-slaves.prompt: Egyptian Pharaoh pointing down with cruel expression - standing above laborers, dressed in royal Egyptian garments, face showing merciless satisfaction at suffering below, demanding more while giving less, tyranny personified

chariot-pursuit.name: Chariot Pursuit
chariot-pursuit.description: Standing in war chariot, pursuing Israel to the sea
chariot-pursuit.prompt: Egyptian Pharaoh standing in golden war chariot - whip raised, reins in other hand, face twisted in vengeful pursuit, royal headdress streaming behind, army behind him, chasing escaped slaves to their doom at the sea

broken-by-plague.name: Broken by Plague
broken-by-plague.description: Momentary weakness after plague, but not true repentance
broken-by-plague.prompt: Egyptian Pharaoh with head slightly bowed - hand to forehead in moment of weakness, royal composure cracking, admitting sin but eyes still calculating, false repentance that will fade when pressure lifts

final-command.name: Release Israel
final-command.description: The moment after death of firstborn - broken, commanding them to leave
final-command.prompt: Egyptian Pharaoh in grief and defeat - royal garments disheveled, eyes hollow from loss of firstborn, arm weakly gesturing for Israel to leave, broken king who finally learned the cost of defiance, too late
